problem_text:
(A. I. Mal’cev). Does there exist a ring without zero divisors which is not embeddable in a skew field, while the multiplicative semigroup of its non-zero elements is embeddable in a group?
L. A. Bokut’
answer: Yes, such groups do exist (L. A. Bokut’, Soviet Math. Dokl., 8 (1967), 901–904; A. Bowtell, J. Algebra, 7 (1967), 126–139; A. Klein, J. Algebra, 7 (1967), 100–125).
